experience: You and Elettra both know Claire Priddy and Tania Katan

Fiumi Studios is a full-service production and online content strategy company with offices in New York, Los Angeles and Florence. Our films have been featured in Architectural Digest, the BBC, Fusion, Monocle, MSNBC, the New Yorker, NBC News Digital, the New York Post, Teen Vogue, Showtime and Univision among others. Our clients include the Ethics Centre, Gagosian Gallery, the International Fine Prints Dealers Association, JWT, Rebecca Taylor, Theory, Unilever and Yale Medicine.

The Granny is a full service production company formed by filmmaking journalists who produce, direct, script, shoot and edit journalism pieces for publications and documentary-style creative content for businesses.Clients include the BBC, MSNBC, The New Yorker, TIME, Aol, Fusion (Univision), Adoptive, YALE Medicine, Storyhunter, Monocle, Cool Hunting, Vocativ, The Economist, The Columbia Journalism Review, Splashlight Studios, Rebecca Taylor, the Gagosian Gallery, the International Fine Prints Dealers Association (IFPDA), Rain Media, The Kurt Weill Foundation, The West Harlem Development Organization, Buzzfeed, the Sundance Channel, LS:N Global, Out 100, Watchup, Likeable, Cheek’d, Mediastudio, Sfera Studios, Senteurs d’Orient, Adventures on Horseback and Mount Holyoke College. The Granny also produced Breaking Glass (msnbc.com/topics/breaking-glass), a weekly online series profiling women pushing boundaries in their fields, industries and/or communities. The Granny received a 2015 Graham Foundation for Advanced Studies in the Fine Arts documentary grant for A Florentine Man documentary (in progress: grahamfoundation.org/grantees/5304-a-florentine-man) and has been featured in PDN (http://www.pdnonline.com/features/techniques/video/Frames-Per-Second-On-Launching-a-Production-Company-16084.shtml), Storyhunter (storyhunter.tv/blog/qa-granny-cart/), Columbia Visuals (columbiavisuals.com/2015/02/04/granny-cart-productions/), Crain's Business (crainsnewyork.com/article/20120708/SMALLBIZ/307089989/j-school-grads-turn-to-startup-scene), Young Female Entrepreneurs, DNAInfo.com and A Small World. The Granny was also a participant of the MIT/Goethe Institut’s Labour In A Single Shot program and the Granny video was selected as part of the program's showcase at the Venice Biennale 2015.

recommendations: January 5, 2009, Elettra worked with Jesse but at different companies

Jesse is an energetic, creative and hard-working individual who is at the forefront of his field. He thinks outside the box while maintaining a practical and ethical standpoint. He has succeeded in inventing a new way of merging entertainment with fund raising. He and his company are making an actual difference by paving ground for emerging talent, introducing established artists to an international audience, and effectively assisting communities in Africa and around the world improve and become self-sustainable.

summary: Journalist, Filmmaker, Entrepreneur. - Founder of Fiumi Studios. - Clients include publications like the BBC, Teen Vogue, NBC News Digital, MSNBC, Showtime, Univision, Fusion, The New Yorker, Bustle; and brands such as the Gagosian Gallery, JWT, the Ethics Centre, the International Fine Prints Dealers Association, Theory, Rebecca Taylor, Yale Medicine, Unilever, California Pizza Kitchen, the Kurt Weill Foundation and others.- Multilingual (English, Italian, Spanish, French).- Organized and led a 3-day conference at AbelCine on Doc-style Content for Brands; workshops at the Made in NY Media Center by IFP on the Business of Video Journalism. - 5+ years in short documentary production for news outlets and advertising. Co-founder of Granny Cart Productions. - 4+ years in lifestyle magazines for American Express Publishing (Travel+Leisure, Departures and Black Ink). - Degrees from Columbia's Journalism School (+ Speaker Director) and Mount Holyoke College (with honors).
name: Elettra Fiumi
title: Fiumi Studios founder. Journalist, filmmaker, entrepreneur.
